pr_title: [miio] add automatic tokens to miio MDNSDiscoveryParticipant

timeline.message:
[miio] add automatic tokens to miio MDNSDiscoveryParticipant

* get tokens from cloud if possible and add them during discovery.
(similar to the other discovery method)

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

timeline.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText:
I tried this:
    private  @Nullable CloudConnector cloudConnector;
    private Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MiIoDiscoveryParticipant.class);

    @Activate
    public void MiIoDiscoveryParticipantStart(@Reference CloudConnector cloudConnector) {
        this.cloudConnector = cloudConnector;
        logger.debug("Start Xiaomi Mi IO mDNS discovery");
    }


I get:

I also tried
@nullable
private CloudConnector cloudConnector;
private Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MiIoDiscoveryParticipant.class);
@Activate
public MiIoDiscoveryParticipant(@Reference CloudConnector cloudConnector) {
    this.cloudConnector = cloudConnector;
    logger.debug("Start Xiaomi Mi IO mDNS discovery");
}
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText: maybe it is just my configuration of my app.bnd as I had some challenges anyway to the whole unpn/mdns stuff working properly in eclipse
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText:
The first try is incorrect you added void so it becomes a method and not a constructor. Therefor I'm more interested in what the error was of you second try. Did it result in the same error?
Regarding eclipse I suspect you need to add the libraries related to the feature openhab-transport-mdns at least in the app.bnd so they can be resolved (add them by dragging them from left to right, just like adding a binding).
replies.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText:
Seems I have some local issue with mDNS. (service info has a null in the address.)
20:55:51.829 [INFO ] [al.discovery.MiIoDiscoveryParticipant] - ServiceInfo: [ServiceInfoImpl@752768110 name: 'zimi-powerstrip-v2_miio62733541._miio._udp.local.' address: '(null):54321' status: 'DNS: JmDNS-/192.168.3.11 [/192.168.3.11] state: probing 1 task: null' is persistent, has NO data, empty]
Anyway, that seems to have caused my problematic testing. I've also added debug message for null ip so it is bit easier to understands what happens as it not silently ignores the mdns result
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.message:
[miio] Update from feedback on cloudconnector in discovery

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>
